thread.title: Trying to predict the future? Just use an algorithm
thread.title_full: Trying to predict the future? Just use an algorithm

title: Trying to predict the future? Just use an algorithm
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Trying to predict the future? Just use an algorithm Two data scientists claim to have created an algorithm that predicts human behaviour faster and more reliably than the majority of its human competitors Corbis Google+ 1 of 1 Two data scientists claim to have created an algorithm that predicts human behaviour faster and more reliably than the majority of its human competitors Corbis Will Pavia New york Last updated at 2:08AM, October 20 2015 
The ancients had their prophets and sibyls and modern man has looked to data scientists, futurologists and the astrology columns of tabloid newspapers for guidance on his destiny. Yet all of these seers may now be outdone by an algorithm. 
That is the implication of a paper by two data scientists at Massachusetts Institute of Technology in the United States. In the paper, which will be presented to a conference in Paris this week, Max Kanter and Kalyan Veeramachaneni claim to have created an algorithm that predicts human behaviour faster and more reliably than the majority of its human competitors. Subscribe now
